t: Genesis 49
Jacob’s Last Words to His Sons
And*p Jacob called his sons and said, “Gather together, that I may tell you what shall befall you in the last days:
“Gather*pn together and hear, you sons of Jacob, And*ld listen to Israel your father.
“Reuben,*ln you are my firstborn, My*ld might and the beginning of my strength, The*ld excellency of dignity and the excellency of power.
Unstable*ld as water, you shall not excel, Because*ld you went up to your father’s bed; Then*ld you defiled it—*i He*ld went up to my couch.
“Simeon*ln and Levi are*i brothers; Instruments*ld of cruelty are*i in*i their dwelling place.
Let*ld not my soul enter their council; Let*ld not my honor be united to their assembly; For*ld in their anger they slew a man, And*ld in their self-will they hamstrung an ox.
Cursed*ld be*i their anger, for it*i is*i fierce; And*ld their wrath, for it is cruel! I*ld will divide them in Jacob And*ld scatter them in Israel.
“Judah,*ln you are*i he*i whom your brothers shall praise; Your*ld hand shall*i be*i on the neck of your enemies; Your*ld father’s children shall bow down before you.
Judah*ld is*i a lion’s whelp; From*ld the prey, my son, you have gone up. He*ld bows down, he lies down as a lion; And*ld as a lion, who shall rouse him?
The*ld scepter shall not depart from Judah, Nor*ld a lawgiver from between his feet, Until*ld Shiloh comes; And*ld to Him shall*i be*i the obedience of the people.
Binding*ld his donkey to the vine, And*ld his donkey’s colt to the choice vine, He*ld washed his garments in wine, And*ld his clothes in the blood of grapes.
His*ld eyes are*i darker than wine, And*ld his teeth whiter than milk.
“Zebulun*ln shall dwell by the haven of the sea; He*ld shall*i become*i a haven for ships, And*ld his border shall adjoin Sidon.
“Issachar*ln is a strong donkey, Lying*ld down between two burdens;
He*ld saw that rest was*i good, And*ld that the land was*i pleasant; He*ld bowed his shoulder to bear a*i burden,*i And*ld became a band of slaves.
“Dan*ln shall judge his people As*ld one of the tribes of Israel.
Dan*ld shall be a serpent by the way, A*ld viper by the path, That*ld bites the horse’s heels So*ld that its rider shall fall backward.
I*ld have waited for your salvation, O Lord!*s
“Gad,*ln a troop shall tramp upon him, But*ld he shall triumph at last.
“Bread*ln from Asher shall*i be*i rich, And*ld he shall yield royal dainties.
“Naphtali*ln is*i a deer let loose; He*ld uses beautiful words.
“Joseph*ln is*i a fruitful bough, A*ld fruitful bough by a well; His*ld branches run over the wall.
The*ld archers have bitterly grieved him, Shot*ld at*i him*i and hated him.
But*ld his bow remained in strength, And*ld the arms of his hands were made strong By*ld the hands of the Mighty God*i of Jacob (From*ld there is*i the Shepherd, the Stone of Israel),

By*ld the God of your father who will help you, And*ld by the Almighty who will bless you With*ild blessings of heaven above, Blessings*ld of the deep that lies beneath, Blessings*ld of the breasts and of the womb.

The*ld blessings of your father Have*ld excelled the blessings of my ancestors, Up*ld to the utmost bound of the everlasting hills. They*ld shall be on the head of Joseph, And*ld on the crown of the head of him who was separate from his brothers.
“Benjamin*ln is a ravenous wolf; In*ld the morning he shall devour the prey, And*ld at night he shall divide the spoil.”
All*p these are*i the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is*i what their father spoke to them. And he blessed them; he blessed each one according to his own blessing.
Jacob’s Death and Burial
Then*p he charged them and said to them: “I am to be gathered to my people; bury me with my fathers in the cave that is*i in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
in the cave that is*i in the field of Machpelah, which is*i before Mamre in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field of Ephron the Hittite as a possession for a burial place.
There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife, there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife, and there I buried Leah.
The field and the cave that is*i there were*i purchased from the sons of Heth.”
And when Jacob had finished commanding his sons, he drew his feet up into the bed and breathed his last, and was gathered to his people.
